sentences: Päeva oli kuidas ta'nd oli, aga öösel jäi mulje, et majas kolab ringi mingi vaim.
Meil on hea päeva teha piknik.
context: The word 'päeva' has multiple grammatical functions in Estonian. It can be the genitive singular form of 'päev' (day), meaning 'of the day'. It can also be the partitive singular form, and the illative singular form, which often indicates movement toward something ('into the day'). As an adverb, it means 'in the daytime' or 'during the day', indicating when something happens. This word is commonly used to specify time frames in daily activities.
